qas.question: Along with Serbian, with what language is Macedonian mutually intelligible?
What dialect continuum does Macedonian belong to?
What do Bulgarian linguists regard the Macedonian language as?
In what year was a Macedonian literary standard established?
In what country is Macedonian most commonly spoken?
With which language is Macedonian mutually unintelligible?
In what year was there a literary standard of Bulgarian developed?
When was a standard of Serbian developed in Macedonia?
In what year was there a literary standard of Slavic developed?

context: Similar examples abound. Macedonian, although mutually intelligible with <a0_0><b5_0>Bulgarian<b5_0/><a0_0/>, certain dialects of Serbian and to a lesser extent the rest of the <a1_0>South Slavic<a1_0/> dialect continuum, is considered by Bulgarian linguists to be <a2_0>a Bulgarian dialect<a2_0/>, in contrast with the contemporary international view and the view in the <a4_0>Republic of Macedonia<a4_0/>, which regards it as a language in its own right. Nevertheless, before the establishment of a literary standard of Macedonian in <a3_0><b6_0><b7_0><b8_0>1944<b8_0/><b7_0/><b6_0/><a3_0/>, in most sources in and out of Bulgaria before the Second World War, the southern Slavonic dialect continuum covering the area of today's Republic of Macedonia were referred to as Bulgarian dialects.
